result.execSummary:
The defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).
  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to count 2; with credit for 142 days time served

superMiscConds.notes:
- Seek and maintain full-time employment.
- Obtain GED.

- Commit no violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
- NO CONTACT with Shantae C., her children and/or grandchildren without consent or at the discretion of Shantae.
- No firearms.

- Cooperate with agent concerning all home and office visits.
- Attend Batters Anonymous or Anger Management.
- Attend all treatment and counseling services as determined by agent.

- Alcohol and Drug Assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
- Random drug testing; Breathalyzers.
- Absolute Sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
BOTH COUNTS: Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges. Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory costs, surcharges and assessments from prison wages and during extended supervision.  Any bail on deposit to apply. Any amount due and owing after extended supervision could result in a civil judgment. Court waived all non-mandatory costs and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Restitution set at $0.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms/body armor/ammunition and/or explosives. Court advised defendant he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count 1; with credit for 0 days time served

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael F Torphy in court for Frederick Lamont Cocroft.  Assistant District Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin.    MN
Court finds the State has complied with Marcy's Law.
Sentencing proceeded. Statements by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by Luerle C., Deborah C., Natrina S.

AS TO COUNT 1:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  16 YEARS,  consecutive to Count 2, with credit for 142 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 11 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 2:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS consecutive to Count 1, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:   Conditions of extended supervision:
*Commit no violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
*Cooperate with agent concerning all home and office visits.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random drug testing, Breathalyzers.
*Absolute Sobriety.
*Attend Batterers Anonymous or Anger Management 
*Attend all treatment and counseling services as determined by agent.
*No Contact with Shantae C., her children and/or grandchildren with out consent or at the discretion of Shantae.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain  GED
*No Firearms
*Pay supervision fees.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2: Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.  
The Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory costs, surcharges and assessments from prison wages and during extended supervision.  Any bail on deposit to apply.
Any amount due and owing after extended supervision could result in a civil judgment.
The Court waived all non-mandatory costs and surcharges due to inability to pay.

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Earned Release Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms/body armor/ammunition and/or explosives.
Court advised defendant he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Court set restitution at $0.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael F Torphy in court for Frederick Lamont Cocroft.  Assistant District Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy  in court for the State of Wisconsin.  This matter had to be adjourned in Br 45.  Case remains calendared for sentencing.  mn
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Family Letters in Support of Defendant, filed.
Letter to the Court.

Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael F. Torphy appeared for defendant, frederick Lamont Ccroft.  Prosecuting attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 
AS TO COUNTS 3 & 4:  Pursuant to negotiations, the Court dismissed but will read in for sentencing purposes.

Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he cannot own or possess any firearms, body armor, ammunition/explosives.  Defendant also advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  No request for presentence investigation.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Br 45.  Defendant remanded.   mn

Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael F Torphy in court for Frederick Lamont Cocroft.  Prosecuting attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury  in court at 9:12 for continuation of trial.  Sworn for the State:  Det. Janay Patterson MPS.  Exhibits 9  & 10 both stipulations, were read to the jury and received by the Court.  The State rests.   Jury out of the box at 10:03.  Side bar placed on the record.  
Defense motion to dismiss Counts 1 & 2 - with no argument.  State requests motion be denied.  For reasons as stated on the record, the Court DENIED defense motion to dismiss Counts 1 & 2.  
The State's new offer was placed on the record.  The defense is requesting additional time to review offer with defendant.  

Jury in the box at 11:15.  The Court will release the jurors for lunch and request their return at 1:30.  Jury out of the box.

Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael F Torphy in court for Frederick Lamont Cocroft.  Prosecuting attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court at 1:40 and sworn by clerk.  Jury list filed.  Court instructs jury.  Opening statement by State.  Defense reserving his right to opening statement to a later time.  Jury out of the box for short break.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for the State:  Officer Khalid Majeed, MPD., cross examination by defense.  Det. Arttavius Bradford MPD, Cross examination by defense. .Exhibits 1,3,4,6,8 Offered and received.  Jury out of the box for a short break.  Jury back in the box.  Sworn for the State:  Shanta C.  The state requests to be allowed to proceed under adverse victim, granted by the court.  Jury excused for a short break.  Jury in the box.  Cross examination of witness.  Redirect by the state.  The Court excused the jury with instructions to return on 9/21 at 8:30 in Br 45.  Jury out of the box.   Side bar placed on the record.

Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael F Torphy in court for Frederick Lamont Cocroft.  Prosecuting attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in court for the State of Wisconsin. Jury panel in the court to begin voir dire at 9:40.  
 
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled.  Jurors were released for lunch with instructions to return to Br 45 at 1:30.  mn

Prosecuting attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Br 45 for Br 4:  Pretrial discussions held on the record.  All motions in limine discussed and ruled.  Case is adjourned for trial in Br 45.  mn
Parties contacted to advise of spin court and advised to proceed to Judge Kies Branch 45. Parties notified.

Victim Shantae Cocroft in court. State advises of body attachment served. State request signature bond. Court orders $1500.00 signature bond. Case passed until 9-20-2022 8:30 am. to look for spin court.
Jury trial scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court denies motion to dismiss at this time. Court orders body attachment. Case passed to address other jury trial calls.

Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in court with Attorney Michael Torphy.  Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, appear in person. Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft not in court, defendant in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defendant not produced.  SPD has not appointed counsel at this time. State requests an Order to Show cause hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to Br. 4.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Frederick Lamont Cocroft appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
